Name: Tall bottle
Description: This tall bottle, which comes from the excavations of the Egypt Exploration Fund at Sedment el-gebel, is characterised by a large strongly concave base, a conical belly, a narrow neck with long cylindrical form and a slightly sloping, smooth annular lip. The piece, which is made of transparent glass of blue-green colour, dates from the 2nd or 3rd century of our time.
